intro: Flueggea angulata, commonly known as the angular flueggea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive angular appearance, giving it its common name. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
